questions.title: Basic Integer Division
questions.explanation: When dividing two integers in C, the result is also an integer. 7 / 3 = 2.333..., but integer division truncates (not rounds) the result, giving us 2.
hints: Integer division truncates the decimal part

questions.title: Float Division from Integers
questions.explanation: Casting 'a' to double before division makes this a floating-point division. 7.0 / 3 = 2.333..., which is printed with 2 decimal places as 2.33.
hints: The (double) cast converts a to a floating-point number
When one operand is a double, the division is floating-point
%.2f formats the output to 2 decimal places

questions.title: Division Order of Operations
questions.explanation: The division a / b happens first (both are ints), resulting in 2. Then 2 is cast to double, giving 2.0. The parentheses around (a / b) ensure integer division happens before the cast.
hints: Pay attention to where the cast is placed
The division happens inside the parentheses first
Integer division gives 2, then it's cast to 2.0

questions.title: Negative Integer Division
questions.explanation: Integer division of -7 / 3 truncates toward zero, giving -2 (not -3). In C, integer division always truncates toward zero.

questions.title: Average Calculation Bug
questions.description: This code tries to calculate an average but gives the wrong result. What needs to be fixed?
options: Need to cast sum or count to double: (double)sum / count
Need to change sum to a double
Need to use float instead of double
questions.explanation: Line 6 performs integer division (sum / count = 100 / 3 = 33), then assigns the result to a double. This gives 33.0 instead of 33.33. Fix: Cast one operand to double: 'double average = (double)sum / count;'
hints: The division happens before assignment to average
sum and count are both integers
You need to cast at least one operand to double

questions.title: Which Cast is Needed?
questions.description: To get a floating-point result from '5 / 2', which cast(s) will work?
questions.code_template:
A) (double)(5 / 2)
B) (double)5 / 2
C) 5 / (double)2
D) Both B and C
questions.explanation: Options B and C both work because casting either operand to double promotes the entire operation to floating-point division. Option A doesn't work because the integer division happens first, giving 2, which is then cast to 2.0.
hints: Casting either operand makes it floating-point division
Option A casts after the division is already done
Both B and C cast before division

questions.title: Mixed Division Output
questions.description: What are ALL the outputs of this program (in order)?
questions.explanation: Line 4: 10 / 4 is integer division = 2. Line 5: 10.0 / 4 is float division = 2.5. Line 6: 10 / 4.0 is also float division = 2.5. When either operand is a float, the result is a float.

questions.title: Function Return Type
questions.description: What should the return statement be to correctly calculate the average as a float?
questions.explanation: To get a floating-point average, you need to cast either sum or 3 to double before division. Both 'return (double)sum / 3;' and 'return sum / 3.0;' work correctly.
hints: You need to return a double
Cast sum to double before dividing

questions.title: Complex Division Expression
questions.explanation: Due to left-to-right evaluation, a / b is calculated first as integer division (5 / 2 = 2), then 2 * 1.0 = 2.0. If you wanted 2.5, you'd need to multiply by 1.0 first: 'a * 1.0 / b' or use casting.
hints: Operations are evaluated left to right
Integer division gives 2 before the multiplication

questions.title: Division with Remainder
questions.explanation: Integer division: 17 / 5 = 3. The modulo operator %: 17 % 5 = 2 (the remainder). So it prints '3 2'.
hints: / gives the quotient in integer division

questions.title: Negative Division
questions.explanation: In C, integer division truncates toward zero. -7 / 2 is -3, and the remainder is -1 because -7 = (-3) * 2 + (-1).
hints: Remainder keeps the sign of the dividend

questions.title: Casting to Double
questions.explanation: Casting a to double makes the division floating-point. 7.0 / 2 = 3.5.

questions.title: Cast After Division
questions.explanation: a / b is integer division first (7 / 2 = 3). Casting after the division makes 3.0.

questions.title: Mixed Types
questions.explanation: a is promoted to double, so the division is floating-point: 5.0 / 2.0 = 2.5.

questions.title: Negative Divisor
questions.explanation: C truncates toward zero, so 7 / -3 is -2. The remainder keeps the sign of the dividend: 7 = (-2) * (-3) + 1.

questions.title: Negative Division
questions.explanation: Integer division truncates toward zero. -7 / 2 = -3.5 truncated to -3.

questions.title: Modulo with Negative
questions.explanation: In C, result of % has same sign as dividend. -7 = -2 * 3 + (-1), so -7 % 3 = -1.

questions.title: Division Order
questions.explanation: Division is left-associative. 10 / 2 = 5, then 5 / 2 = 2.

questions.title: Mixed Type Division
questions.explanation: Mixed int/double promotes to double division. 7.0 / 2.0 = 3.5.

questions.title: Rounding Up Division
questions.description: Which expression rounds up integer division a/b?
questions.code_template:
int a = 7, b = 3;
// Want ceiling of 7/3 = 3 (not 2)

questions.title: Bitwise AND
questions.explanation: Bitwise AND: 1100 & 1010 = 1000 = 8 in decimal.

questions.title: Bitwise OR
questions.explanation: Bitwise OR: 1100 | 1010 = 1110 = 14 in decimal.

questions.title: Left Shift
questions.explanation: Left shift by 1 multiplies by 2. 5 << 1 = 10.

questions.title: Right Shift
questions.explanation: Right shift by 2 divides by 4. 16 >> 2 = 4.
